numbered_ace_sentences: 1. In each surveyed form of communication, young women reach out to their parents more often on average than young men.
2. The gap between young women and young men is much larger for electronic communication.
3. Electronic communication is communication through texts or calls.
4. For texts or calls, young women reach out to their parents about 20 percentage points more than young men.
5. Young women visit their parents in person more often on average than young men.
6. For in-person visits, the difference is only a few percentage points.
7. I wonder how these differences look for groups that are broken down beyond gender.
8. I wonder how these differences look for groups that are broken down beyond the age range from 18 to 34.
9. I want to see data for college-age people from 18 to 24.
10. For many people, the age from 18 to 24 is a first experience of living away from home.
11. A 34-year-old person may have lived away from the parents for 16 years.
12. College students still live at home in a technical sense.
13. College students are usually dependent on their parents in some way.
14. Many 34-year-old people live on their own.
15. Many 34-year-old people are fully independent from their parents.
16. This topic relates to me and my community.
17. I am a male.
18. I am in the age range from 18 to 34.
19. I will be in this age range for many more years.
20. The disparity is concerning to me.
21. This disparity makes me more conscious of how often I communicate with my parents.
22. I should consider this more in the future.
23. The headline is: How Often Do You Check on Your Parents?
